MultiModal Workflow.Q: What is the e-Tender notice number and the purpose of the tender mentioned in the document?
MultiModal Workflow.A: The e-Tender notice number is NITJ/DRC/PUR/TT/36/2024. The purpose is to invite e-tenders for the fabrication of a machine for continuous production of textile waste-based composite materials for the Department of Textile Technology.

MultiModal Workflow.Q: What are the eligibility criteria for bidders to participate in this tender?
MultiModal Workflow.A: Bidders must be Class I or Class II Local Suppliers. They need to provide a declaration of local content, submit technical bid documents, and ensure no conditional bids. Bidders must also submit Tender fees/EMD/Exemption Certificates.

MultiModal Workflow.Q: What are the deadlines for submitting the online bids and physically submitting the tender fee and EMD?
MultiModal Workflow.A: Online bids must be submitted by 06.11.2024, 03:00 PM. The physical submission of Tender Fee and EMD must be received by 03:00 PM on the next working day if the submission date falls on a holiday.

MultiModal Workflow.Q: What is the role of Annexure-G in determining supplier eligibility, and how is local content defined?
MultiModal Workflow.A: Annexure-G is a self-declaration form that suppliers submit to declare the local content of their products. Suppliers are categorized as Class I (50%+ local content), Class II (20-50%), or Non-local (<20%). Only Class I and II suppliers are eligible.

MultiModal Workflow.Q: What is the payment structure for the successful supplier as mentioned in the document?
MultiModal Workflow.A: The payment structure is not explicitly mentioned. It highlights that disputes regarding the Bank Guarantee are resolved according to the terms and conditions of the order, with further details provided in the full tender document.

MultiModal Workflow.Q: What are the warranty obligations for suppliers as outlined in Annexure-F?
MultiModal Workflow.A: Suppliers must provide a warranty from the date of installation, covering free after-sale service, part replacements, and preventive maintenance visits. Any delay in repairs will incur a penalty. The supplier is responsible for spares and maintenance throughout the warranty period.

MultiModal Workflow.Q: How is the technical bid evaluated, and what criteria are used for shortlisting bidders?
MultiModal Workflow.A: The technical bid is evaluated on criteria like eligibility, completeness of documents, and compliance with equipment specifications. The location of service centers, authorization certificates, and service policies are also assessed before shortlisting bidders.

MultiModal Workflow.Q: What penalties are imposed for delays in delivery or non-performance by the supplier?
MultiModal Workflow.A: A penalty of 0.5% per week (up to 10% of the value) is imposed for delivery delays. Non-performance penalties require the supplier to maintain 95% uptime over 365 days and impose a similar penalty for delays in rectifying defects.

MultiModal Workflow.Q: What does Annexure-E specify about the blacklisting or debarment of suppliers?
MultiModal Workflow.A: Annexure-E states that bidders should not be blacklisted by any government department. If false information is provided, the tender can be canceled, and the bidder may face actions like blacklisting and forfeiting the EMD.

MultiModal Workflow.Q: What does Annexure-D require from suppliers regarding manufacturer authorization?
MultiModal Workflow.A: Annexure-D requires suppliers to authorize their agents or distributors to bid on their behalf. The supplier guarantees and provides a warranty for goods supplied through their agents or distributors, ensuring they are liable for all actions of the agent.
